captions.text:
Hey Vsauce I'm Jake and if you've played Injustice:
Gods Among Us, you know how awesome it is
to be Superman and punch people into space. But what if he were to hit you in real life?

What would happen if someone who is able to
lift 200 quintillion tons with one hand, power

the sun or, my favorite, punch dimensions
apart...were to punch you?

And this brings up an interesting idea: Superman
-- and really any fictional character -- is

only as powerful as the person writing them.
He has gone from being able to leap tall buildings

in a single bound to moving faster than the
speed of light. In this theory, no matter

how strong Superman is, there is one universal
law of physics he can't break--that nothing

with mass can achieve--travelling the speed
of light. So we will put him 1% below that

299,792,458 m/s limit at 99% the speed of
light.

So you're, unfortunately, in a fight with
the Man of Steel who, in this case, will not

restrain himself when hitting you. If his
fist has an average mass of 300 grams and

it's moving at 99% the speed of light, it
would have a total energy of about 190,000,000,000,000,000

joules. Which is equivalent to 45 Megatons
of TNT or over 2,800 times more powerful than
the nuclear bomb dropped on Hiroshima. Throwing just one punch at near the

speed of light with that much energy would
burn around 45,400,000,000,000 calories or
almost 82 billion Big Macs.

Now you have one of the largest bombs ever, condensed
into a fist, and aimed at your face. What
happens when Superman releases that punch?

This is when it gets incredibly cool...or
incredibly hot since the energy being released

by Superman's fist would be around 80,000,000,000,000
Kelvin, which is 5 million times hotter than
the core of our sun.

It takes about 1 centisecond for the light
that hits your retina to then be processed

by the brain, so since the punch is travelling
at near the speed of light, it would only

take 3.4 Nanoseconds for the fist to get to
you. So you literally wouldn't see it coming.

But what we can see is that from the fist's
perspective, since it is moving at an amazing

296 million meters a second, all of time is
practically frozen. The particles in the air,

the oxygen and nitrogen, are just suspended
in time. And Superman's hand hits them with

such energy that it creates nuclear fusion.
Gamma rays explode from every collision and

create an explosion unlike any the Earth has
ever seen. A giant fireball engulfs the surrounding

area and a blast wave shoots out, shattering
windows, structures and rips trees out of

the ground. There might be fictional characters
with more powerful punches, but at this point,

when it comes to you still existing, it doesn't
matter...

Superman wouldn't only knock the wind out
of you, he would knock the atoms out of you.

His fist has pretty much become a particle
beam. At 7,000,000,000 electron volts it is

more powerful than the Jefferson Labs Particle
Accelerator in Virginia. The atoms that made

up you would be completely disintegrated,
liquified at the atomic level. You'd turn

into fundamental particles and quark-gluon
plasma which is what was created right after

the Big Bang. And from all of this energy,
new particles and anti-particles would form.

So out of your unfortunate destruction, something
new, something we might not have ever seen
before, could be created.

To visualize the explosion we can use Nuke
Map to see what a 45 megaton bomb would look

like in terms of sheer damage, but what we
can't really show is that the damage from Superman's

punch would look more like a traffic cone
with a beam shooting out from where his fist

landed, destroying everything in its path
and creating an explosion all around him.

It would leave a crater almost 1km in diameter
and 221 meters deep.

So how close could you or I come to having
'Superman's strength'? My friends at AsapSCIENCE

breakdown strength muscle growth and how superhuman
strength may be more attainable than ever
before.

Don't piss of Superman and as always, thanks
for watching.

comments.text:
Goku fans hear me out..
1. Thanks to Superman, the word Superhero was invented and this was the 
foundation for all of other Superheros regardless of their respected 
Universe (DC,Marvel,Anime,Cartoon etc)

2. God father of ALL Superheros (since he is the first superhero to ever 
been created)

3. Thanks to Superman, the creator of Goku Series was inspired by Superman 
and it's origin..(hence why they have identical origin). This was even said 
in the interview.

4. As most of you guys know, One Piece anime series was inspired by Goku 
anime series and Goku anime was inspired by Superman. My point is that, all 
is connected.

Instead of hating, give appreciation. Cheers﻿

comments.text:
+Cham Wow The difference is that superman is fictional. The laws of physics 
don't necessarily apply to him. But according to comics he can punch with 
the same amount of force he lifts. Since the flash hit's slightly faster, 
his kinetic energy will build force up faster than superman's, but 
superman's force is already 200 billion billion tons a head of flashes 500 
pounds at first, also remember that superman is gaining energy also, just 
not as fast, but close. That's a very large number for anything to catch up 
too, especially something that starts off with only about 500 pounds of 
force at first compared to something starting off with 200 billion billion 
tons of force. But I may be missing something lol.
comments.author: CJ Jordan

comments.text:
Lifting strength does not correlate to punching strength. Which is why 
professional fighters cant compete with professional weight lifters or vise 
versa.  force of a punch has to do with speed and mass, technique 
determines how much of your mass you can put into the punch and how fast 
your fist is moving when you make contact. since a punch is the transfer of 
kinetic energy where e=1/2*m*v^2 with speed/velocity being dominant even if 
the flash is going .1% faster than superman he would be throwing the 
stronger punch.
comments.author: Cham Wow

comments.text:
+Infinite Sheldon I agree. If you removed plot armor, morality, and 
knowledge about the opponent and pit Batman against Superman and both had 
to feel each other out right then and there, Batman loses 100% of the time. 
I don't know why people insist on even arguing this. Batman, as smart as he 
is, could never defeat such an opponent having to fight in the moment. It's 
literally like arguing a scenario in which a spider can kill a human. Not 
likely at all without a contrived circumstance.
comments.author: James B

comments.text:
+Samuel Weinstein "Wrong. It isn't "fanwank" to have someone win a fight 
through means other than physical strength."

It is when the only win conditions require one of the combatants to be 
arbitrarily nerfed---which is precisely what you most recently proposed 
with "leap tall buildings in a single bound Superman".  Take away PIS, Plot 
Armor and fanwank: Batman loses in less than a second every time.

"Forget it, I'm done arguing with you. Butthurt fanboys are pathetic."

Don't let the door hit you in the ass on the way out.  Your butt's too hurt 
as is.
comments.author: Infinite Sheldon

comments.text:
+Infinite Sheldon
"PIS, Plot Armour and fanwank".
Wrong. It isn't "fanwank" to have someone win a fight through means other 
than physical strength.

Forget it, I'm done arguing with you. Butthurt fanboys are pathetic.
comments.author: Samuel Weinstein

comments.text:
+Samuel Weinstein "Depends on who is telling the story, really. Batman 
could easily kill "leap tall buildings in a single bound" Superman..."

So PIS, Plot Armour and fanwank.
comments.author: Infinite Sheldon

comments.text:
+TraceOfAnxiety
Depends on who is telling the story, really. Batman could easily kill "leap 
tall buildings in a single bound" Superman...

Or use those pills from the Injustice line.
comments.author: Samuel Weinstein

comments.text:
+Infinite Sheldon Yeah, they've also stated his brain processes information 
faster than a supercomputer... Bats is extremely outmatched lol.
comments.author: TraceOfAnxiety

comments.text:
+Song An Lê "Superman is smarter than Batman? Then you have never read DC 
comics"

According to DC comics and the rights holders of the franchise, Superman 
possesses Superhuman Intelligence and Batman doesn't possess superhuman 
anything.  So yes, he's smarter than Batman in every mental capacity. 
 Batman is outclassed in every respect and the gap between them is 
insurmountable.  Batman should stick to assaulting the mentally ill, he has 
no business fighting anything on Superman's level.
comments.author: Infinite Sheldon

comments.text: Superman is smarter than Batman? Then you have never read DC comics
comments.author: Song An Lê

comments.text:
+Samuel Weinstein "Not the surrounding area; he'd destroy whatever's 
nearby."

The "surrounding area" is not "the world".  Superman causes massive 
collateral damage all the time, knocking over buildings and destroying 
entire neighborhoods.

But if it means so much to you. think long and hard on the best conceivable 
armour Batman can use, then calculate the minimum amount of Newtonian Force 
necessary to put him into a coma in spite of that armor from one 
application of blunt force trauma.  Superman has calculated that in less 
than a 1000th of a second and has delivered it to Batman faster than the 
Bat can either perceive or react.  

It takes a fair amount of PIS for Batman to be conscious one second after 
the fight begins.
comments.author: Infinite Sheldon

comments.text: Not the surrounding area; he'd destroy whatever's nearby.
comments.author: Samuel Weinstein

comments.text:
+Samuel Weinstein "Superman wouldn't be able to throw a punch at that 
speed, however. He wouldn't risk destroying the world."

This video shows the world surviving his fist hitting Batman's face at 99% 
the speed of light.
comments.author: Infinite Sheldon

comments.text:
+Infinite Sheldon
Superman wouldn't be able to throw a punch at that speed, however. He 
wouldn't risk destroying the world.
comments.author: Samuel Weinstein

comments.text:
+Samuel Weinstein "No matter how much he reads, he still isn't as clever as 
Batman, nor will he have the same ability to think on his feet."

Superman moves at relativistic speeds and possesses nanosecond reaction 
time.  For every second that passes, Superman has the equivalent of at 
least one century to think and respond to anything Batman does.  You're 
drinking the PIS if you think Batman can think on his feet better than 
Superman.

"He might be human, but he's still smarter."

See above.  Superman memorized the sum total of human medical information 
in five minutes and then invented a new medical treatment.  Batman is a 
pocket calculator and Superman is a supercomputer.  That's the difference 
between their minds.  You'd have to seriously nerf Superman to think a 
human can be smarter.

"all it would take is one smear-campaign as Bruce Wayne to completely 
discredit Superman and reveal his identity."

The world likes Superman more than Batman, the people have a lower opinion 
of Bruce Wayne than Clark Kent, and Superman is romantically involved with 
a Pulitzer Prize winning journalist.  Superman can launch a smear campaign 
against the Bat far more effectively than vice versa.  

"Also, they wouldn't have the same preparation  time. Batman would have 
calculated that down to a tee, because he's a meticulous planner who 
wouldn't leave things up to a "fair fight"."

See "relativistic speeds" and "nanosecond reaction time".  No amount of 
prep time can account for what Superman can accomplish within a single 
second.  One second is one century of prep time for Superman, and that's 
after the fight begins.

"Batman might even get the backing of VILLAINS, given as he mostly fights 
crime on a municipal level (Gotham) and consequentially has less enemies."

This video shows what happens to a city when Superman throws a single punch 
and you propose having multiple persons punching each other with similar 
effect?  So Batman's solution is to inadvertently trigger Nuclear Winter 
and wipe out all human life on Earth.  Good jorb, Bats, you're still dead 
(probably vaporized at ground zero as a bystander) and Superman is still 
standing.  It would take a fair amount of Plot Armour for the end result to 
be anything different.

""Something to counter it" may not exist, canonically speaking. You can't 
just make shit up and use it in a debate, lol."

Superman's powers and abilities counter everything Batman does.  The 
Fortress of Solitude is 0.13 seconds away from Superman and it is better 
stocked than the Batcave.

Batman's only win condition is for Superman to do absolutely nothing in 
response to anything. You could use the same argument for a humble cabbage 
salesman beating Batman in a fight. As I've said, it takes a fair amount of 
PIS and Plot Armour for the Bat to last a single second against Superman.
comments.author: Infinite Sheldon
